title: Textile, ca. 1775–85
medium:
Medium: linen warp, cotton weft
Technique: plain weave foundation; mordant for brown; printed by engraved copperplate
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 135.3 x 73 cm (53 1/4 x 28 3/4 in.)
Repeat H: 77.5 cm (30 1/2 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment
description: Repeat of four oval-shaped outdoor scenes which fill the full width of the fabric.  Scenes include: a covered wagon "Newcastle to London" and passengers; carriage with travelers hearing their fortune; two men fighting over two dead animals; and two women in a garden with gazebo, spied upon by a man behind a hedge.  Pattern printed over both edges.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ca. 1775–85.
ca. 1775–85. Medium: linen warp, cotton weft
Technique: plain weave foundation; mordant for brown; printed by engraved copperplate. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment. 1976-10-1.
